data.title: False Negatives on is_colliding() When Colliding with Floor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows and 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I was using a is_colliding() call, but for some reason while the object is indeed colliding and staying still with the terrain, the call is returning false. Even stranger is that the call returns true if it collides with a wall or the crease where the slope starts.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Download this:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8GPmOdcLf_fYm5YdUQzekJzUUk

Open it and run the scene. You should notice in the output that it says "Colliding" when you press against a wall, but not when you are idling or moving along the floor.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8GPmOdcLf_fYm5YdUQzekJzUUk0111222

data.title: Previews of (texture) rewsources don't update after update in 2.1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Previews of resources (tested only with textures) are not updating after change on disk and auto update.

data.title: Drag n Drop in Scene Tree issues with moving nodes and moving out of parent.
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It's impossible to move nodes in the same level. They always parent to some node even when highlight line shows it will move between two nodes.
The same with moving nodes out of level/parent to higher level one instead being moved out of parent they are re parented to different subtree.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create sub tree and duplicate it few times. Then try to move them out of parent or change positions.

regarding [1566da2](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4373)

data.title: *Array bindings
data.body:
Added `append(), append_array(), insert(), remove()` bindings for `*Array`
Also synced classref and added classref for said functions. There might be a reason these bindings were not added, although I don't know of one.

data.title: Doctool erroneously reorders constants or mixed strings
data.body:
See this sync diff where constants got badly reordered: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/16ea10c35894ba3c24730382fde71934fb549fb4

And also this PR where a string was moved to a wrong function: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/5239

data.title: Assetlib additional features
data.body:
- Hashes checked when downloading (won't work with currently-deployed version on the site)
- <kbd>Support...</kbd> now works
- Project manager works fine now
- Auto-reload on category/sort/support/reverse change

data.body: Makes this method explictly return a value. Fixes compiler error in Visual Studio.

data.title: Object: get_signal_connection_list fixed
data.body:
now returns only the connections for the signal argument, as specified
fixes #5329

data.title: target_fps affects the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows x64, Godot master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Setting a value for the `target_fps` project setting seems to affect the editor. For instance, by setting it to a very low number, like 2 (as I did for some testing), after exiting and restarting the editor it will be laggy, tooltips will fail to appear, the script editor will be anything but agile, etc.

What was expected is that it only had an effect over the running game.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set `target_fps` to 2 in _Scene -> Project Settings -> Application_.
2. Exit the editor and reopen it at the same project.
3. Although anything in the editor will be laggy, type something in the script editor to clearly see what happens.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

N/A

data.title: sin cos and tan not working properly
data.body:
The sin cos and tan functions don't seem to be working properly.
For example, if I use atan(164 / 290), it returns "0.515879" instead of returning the angle value which should be 26 or so.

data.title: Object.get_signal_connection_list does not use signal parameter
data.body:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/0729c852b4f459b9cb6350f564136e3e8aa6c2cf/core/object.cpp#L1313-L1335

`Array Object::_get_signal_connection_list(const String& p_signal) const` has `p_signal` parameter, but no use in method.
it would be better to remove parameter for getting all signal connection list easily and removing confuse.

data.title: Added caret blink to line edit
data.body:
Added caret blink to line edit, and exposed to gdscript. It's currently off by default.

It currently shares the setting with the text_editor. 

closes #3094

data.title: Debug build spamming "det==0" when areas are used
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debug, custom build, not the latest version, but since 12 Jun anyway.

**Details:**
I have areas attached to rigid bodies, and whenever area receives NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED - it sometimes receives a zero matrix, which means determinant is always zero, and spams hell of a lot. I tried debugging so here's the callstack: 

Matrix3::invert
Transform::affine_invert
Transform::affine_inverse
AreaSW::set_transform
PhysicsServerSW::area_set_transform
CollisionObject::_notification

Origin (last row) is actually changing. Not really sure what causes this, it can start spamming when the game starts, or it might not spam at all no matter how long I try to recreate it. I know it's not going to on Release build, but still. Maybe I'm doing something wrong, but I'm pretty sure areas are just following my rigidbodies that's all.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Text editor caret hidden after opened any menu(File, Edit, Search, etc.)
**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Create any project and add some script.
2) Enter to any Text Editor menu.
3) A caret now hidden.
To show a caret you need "Reload Theme".
Bug maybe introduced in 8cbd0b9 commit.
**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: correct current Intent for android
data.body:
Push notification can have extra data in Intent.
You can get extra data with `activity.getIntent().getExtras()`.

Problem is `getIntent()` return first `Intent` that launched activity.

You can get app to foreground with push notification when app is in background.
In this case, the `Intent` that brings to foreground with push notification is not the same as first `Intent`.
You can not get `getExtras()` properly with this new `Intent` by doing `activity.getIntent().getExtras()`.
So, current intent should be updated.

data.title: Godot material indices always revert to null, even with material merge activated (2.1 alpha)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win10 64 bit; Godot 2.1 alpha (daily build from today)

**Issue description** **(what happened, and what was expected):**
See this image (particularly the right side where the indices are).
![godot_multimat](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/16205204/5315d89e-36e8-11e6-9775-723254ae055c.jpg)

In the newest build, a straight re-import should keep the values for the material index slots intact (providing that no material indices were removed when editing the geometry in Blender). However, the importer still does a full overwrite and resets every value to _null_. This even happens when just re-exporting the scene with no changes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the file, and assign a material override to all three indices on the cube. Now go to the import menu and re-import the testing2.dae. file that came with the project. Notice how every material assigned inside of Godot disappears (even though the material merge option was checked).

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Merge.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/324034/Merge.zip)

data.title: New loop interpolation setting doesn't get saved with the scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 - latest (v2.1.alpha.custom_build)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The new loop interpolation setting as merged from https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4724 doesn't get saved with the scene. It is always set to 1 and therefore always enabled.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create animation player, create animation, create animation track. The loop interpolation button is enabled by default. Disable it. Save the scene, close and reopen it. It is enabled again.
